DPRK Holidays to Be Marked in India 
    Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The Indian national preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was formed with due ceremony in New Delhi on Jan. 15.
 At the ceremony P. Shiv Shankar, chairman of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association who is former foreign minister, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. And seven personages including Debabrata Biswas, general secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc, Romesh Chandra, honorary president of the World Peace Council, and Vishwanath, director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, were elected vice-chairmen of the committee and Om Prakash Mantri, secretary general of the Asian Regional Committee to Support Korea's Reunification,  its secretary general.    
 The preparatory committee set a commemoration period from Jan. 20 to Apr. 20 and decided to widely organize colorful events including meeting, seminar, lecture, film show and photo exhibition to briskly introduce the brilliant revolutionary life of President Kim Il Sung, the Songun revolutionary leadership exploits of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and the successes achieved by the Korean people in the efforts to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and reunify the country independently and peacefully.
